FuncDef: The display mac-vlan command displays MAC-VLAN entries when VLANs are classified based on MAC addresses. The display mac-vlan command displays MAC-VLAN entries when VLANs are classified based on MAC addresses. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the MAC-VLAN entries of a specified VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the MAC address to be queried.
The format is H-H-H. H is a hexadecimal number ranging from 1 to 4, for example, 00e0 and fc01. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0.
